Theron denies ‘ghosting’ Penn

There were reports that Charlize Theron was ghosting Sean Penn before their break up last year but the actor has rubbished it, calling it a “crazy story.” Theron opened up about her split with Penn for the April issue of WSJ magazine.

“There is a need to sensationalise things. When you leave a relationship there has to be some...crazy story or some crazy drama. And the...ghosting thing, like literally, I still don’t even know what it is. It’s just its own beast.”

Ghosting, or the slow fade, is a 21{+s}{+t}Century dating phenomenon in which one person ends a relationship by simply disappearing. “We were in a relationship and then it didn’t work anymore. And we both decided to separate. That’s it,” she said. — PTI
title: ENT-THERON
